tournament.name: Pro Tour Born of the God (Valencia, Spain)

decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to gain control of the game through countering and removing opponent's threats, while also utilizing powerful instant-speed spells to maintain card advantage. The deck aims to control the board with counterspells like Cryptic Command and Mana Leak, removal cards like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, and sweepers like Anger of the Gods. It also has access to card draw and life gain with Sphinx's Revelation and Ajani Vengeant. By efficiently removing threats and gaining card advantage, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and eventually win the game.

This deck is focused on assembling a combination of creatures to create powerful synergies and win conditions. It includes a variety of creatures that can be fetched and played with the help of Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. The creatures in the deck provide a toolbox of options for different situations, such as removal with Shriekmaw or Orzhov Pontiff, disruption with Spellskite or Linvala, and recurring value with Eternal Witness or Reveillark. The deck also includes key mana producers, such as Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch, to ensure efficient mana development.

The main objective of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo, which involves enchanting Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite with Splinter Twin to create an infinite number of hasty tokens. This combo allows for a quick win condition by overwhelming the opponent with an endless stream of creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Remand and Cryptic Command to protect the combo and control the board state. Additionally, efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash help take care of any threats that may hinder the combo's success.

The main idea of this deck is to generate infinite combo loops using Splinter Twin enchantment on Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create endless copies of the creature, allowing the player to deal lethal damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage, Vendilion Clique, and Cryptic Command for control and disruption, while Lightning Bolt and Electrolyze provide additional removal and reach. The deck's consistency and flexibility make it a powerful force in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on flooding the board with cheap artifact creatures and using Cranial Plating to boost their power and toughness. The key strategy is to get a fast start with cards like Vault Skirge and Signal Pest, while also utilizing cards like Arcbound Ravager and Steel Overseer to maximize the effectiveness of your artifacts. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures equipped with Cranial Plating, while also having protection and card draw options to maintain consistency and tempo.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells, while utilizing combo pieces like Amulet Titan and Vedalken Shackles. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Blood Moon and Spreading Seas, and generate card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Cryptic Command. Additionally, the deck has a strong finisher in the form of Batterskull and Master of Waves. The mana base is designed to consistently provide the necessary colors while also being resilient to cards like Blood Moon.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Splinter Twin and either Deceiver Exarch or Restoration Angel to create an infinite token or untap effect, allowing for a quick win condition. It also includes interactive spells like Path to Exile, Remand, Lightning Bolt, and Lightning Helix to control the game and protect the combo. The manabase is optimized for consistency and the deck aims to efficiently execute its game plan while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly building up mana with cards like Desperate Ritual and Manamorphose in order to cast multiple spells in one turn, triggering Pyromancer Ascension. Once the deck has established this engine, it can effectively cast multiple copies of Grapeshot to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Faithless Looting and Serum Visions help to filter through the deck to find the necessary combo pieces, while Past in Flames allows for a powerful graveyard recursion strategy. The deck aims to win in a single explosive turn through a combination of spells and card advantage.

This deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle by utilizing efficient creatures like Goblin Guide, Geist of Saint Traft, and Tarmogoyf, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the three-color strategy, allowing for consistency in casting spells. Overall, the main idea is to apply pressure early on and keep up the aggression to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck revolves around assembling the pieces needed to combo off and win the game with Ad Nauseam as quickly as possible. The deck relies on using cards like Lotus Bloom and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana quickly, while also using cards like Angel's Grace and Phyrexian Unlife to stay alive long enough to execute the combo. With the right sequence of spells and cards, this deck can consistently win on turn 4 or earlier, making it a powerful and fast-paced combo deck in the Modern format.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly play low-cost creatures with hexproof and then buff them with powerful enchantments to create unstoppable threats that are difficult for the opponent to remove or block. The inclusion of cards like Daybreak Coronet and Ethereal Armor allows for massive boosts in power and toughness, while cards like Spirit Mantle and Suppression Field provide additional utility and protection. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach, leveraging the hexproof ability to maintain board presence and deal damage efficiently.

This deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor for a variety of creatures to create combos and outvalue opponents. The deck utilizes a toolbox strategy, with each creature serving a specific purpose in the combo chain. Key cards like Kitchen Finks, Melira, and Murderous Redcap work together to generate infinite life or damage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of cards like Spellskite and Abrupt Decay to control the board and protect the combo pieces. The goal is to assemble the combo quickly and overwhelm the opponent with value and resilience.

The key idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach using Merfolk creatures. The deck focuses on maximizing the abilities of Merfolk creatures like Cursecatcher, Lord of Atlantis, and Master of the Pearl Trident to enhance the power and toughness of all Merfolk on the battlefield. It also uses cards like Spreading Seas and Tidebinder Mage to disrupt the opponent's strategy and neutralize their threats. Additionally, the inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quick creature deployment, while spells like Remand and Vapor Snag provide control and tempo advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Splinter Twin and either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite hasty token creatures. The deck includes ways to protect the combo pieces, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and control the board with cards like Cryptic Command, Lightning Bolt, and Remand. The combination of efficient creatures, card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Serum Visions, and powerful removal spells make this deck a strong contender in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a powerful creature with Hexproof by enchanting it with auras. The key strategy is to protect this creature from removal spells and attacks while enhancing its power with various enchantments. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large, hexproof creature that is difficult to deal with, allowing for consistent aggression and damage output. The inclusion of cards like Keen Sense and Daybreak Coronet help to further enhance the creature's abilities and provide additional utility in combat situations.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a powerful creature with hexproof (Gladecover Scout or Slippery Bogle), then enchant it with auras like Daybreak Coronet, Ethereal Armor, Rancor, and Spirit Mantle to make it even more difficult for opponents to deal with. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and evasive threat that becomes increasingly difficult to remove or block as more auras are attached. The inclusion of cards like Path to Exile and Unflinching Courage provides additional protection and removal options.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. By utilizing a combination of combo pieces like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Deceiver Exarch, along with value creatures like Voice of Resurgence and Kitchen Finks, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a versatile and powerful board state. The inclusion of cards like Aven Mindcensor and Linvala, Keeper of Silence also disrupt the opponent's strategy, making it difficult for them to effectively respond to the deck's threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through your cards to get low-cost creatures into the graveyard, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield at once. This combo allows you to overwhelm your opponent with a sudden influx of creatures, while also using cards like Beast Within and Fulminator Mage to disrupt their strategy. The deck aims to take advantage of the Living End mechanic to win the game quickly and decisively.

The main focus of this Golgari Aggro deck is to quickly deploy powerful creatures such as Tarmogoyf, Phyrexian Obliterator, and Dark Confidant to apply early pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek, Thoughtseize, and Abrupt Decay to disrupt the opponent's game plan while Liliana of the Veil provides additional control and discard. The deck utilizes the Golgari color combination to efficiently use graveyard interaction and removal spells to create a fast-paced and aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressively deploying efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Geist of Saint Traft, supported by mana ramp from Noble Hierarch to overwhelm opponents quickly. Tribal Flames serves as a versatile removal spell or finisher, while Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix provide additional burn damage. The deck also has disruption with Path to Exile and Lingering Souls for added resilience. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color aggressive strategy, ensuring consistent and powerful plays throughout the game.

This deck focuses on creating an infinite combo by using cards like Deceiver Exarch, Pestermite, and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker paired with Splinter Twin to produce multiple tokens for a lethal attack. It also includes cards like Spellskite and Dispel for protection and control elements to ensure the combo goes off successfully. The mana base is optimized for fetching the necessary colors and lands quickly to establish the combo as soon as possible. The key strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces and protecting them until victory is achieved.

The deck revolves around the Splinter Twin combo, where you use Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to untap a creature enchanted with Splinter Twin to create an infinite amount of hasty tokens. The deck includes disruption spells like Cryptic Command and Remand to protect the combo, along with removal and card draw to control the game until you can assemble the combo. It is important to carefully manage your resources and timing to ensure a successful combo finish.

The deck focuses on assembling the Splinter Twin combo, utilizing Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to untap Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and create an infinite number of hasty tokens. The deck includes control elements like Remand, Spell Pierce, and Cryptic Command to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Flame Slash, and Electrolyze help keep the board clear. The deck aims to control the game early on and then combo off for a quick win once the pieces are in place.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and cantrips to set up a combo with Pyromancer Ascension and Past in Flames, allowing the player to chain spells together to generate a lethal Grapeshot. The key strategy is to efficiently draw and play through the deck to find the necessary pieces for the combo, while using cards like Goblin Electromancer and rituals to accelerate the process. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn once it has assembled its key combo pieces.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the Ad Nauseam combo by using mana acceleration from cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism. The key strategy involves casting Ad Nauseam to draw the entire deck and then win the game by using Lightning Storm to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Angel's Grace can protect against losing the game due to drawing cards with a health cost, while Pact of Negation provides protection against disruption from the opponent. The deck is designed to quickly and efficiently execute the combo to secure victory.

This deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, aiming to quickly reduce the opponent's life total through direct damage and creature attacks. It utilizes fast land fetching with cards like Arid Mesa and Scalding Tarn to consistently have the right mana available. Key creatures like Goblin Guide and Vexing Devil deal early damage, while cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack provide additional damage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's signature spells like Bump in the Night, Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Rift Bolt ensure a steady stream of damage, while Searing Blaze and Shard Volley target both creatures and players.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of powerful creatures and disruption spells. The main objective is to use "Gifts Ungiven" to search the deck for specific cards, such as "Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite" or "Iona, Shield of Emeria" to reanimate with "Unburial Rites". It also includes a suite of removal spells like "Path to Exile" and "Maelstrom Pulse" to handle threats, along with disruption spells like "Thoughtseize" and "Inquisition of Kozilek" to disrupt the opponent's game plan.Overall, this deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent through efficient card selection and reanimation.

The deck focuses on playing efficient threats early in the game and disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells. It also utilizes removal spells to deal with opposing threats while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Raging Ravine. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent through a combination of card advantage provided by cards like Dark Confidant and Courser of Kruphix, while also having the flexibility to deal with a variety of threats through a diverse suite of removal spells.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo of creatures that work together synergistically to gain incremental advantages and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a toolbox approach, the deck has access to a variety of creatures with diverse abilities that can be searched for and put into play using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. The key strategy is to efficiently tutor for and deploy creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up a combo finish with cards like Melira, Kitchen Finks, and Murderous Redcap.

This deck focuses on aggressive and efficient creature plays while using powerful removal spells to control the board. The key strategy is to quickly establish a strong board presence with creatures like Tarmogoyf, Knight of the Reliquary, and Thundermaw Hellkite, supported by mana ramp from Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise. Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix provide instant removal and reach, while Path to Exile helps deal with problematic threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast creatures and burn spells, finishing the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively building up a strong board presence through powerful and efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Phyrexian Obliterator, supported by disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Victim of Night to deal with opposing threats. Liliana of the Veil provides additional control and disruption, while cards like Kitchen Finks and Scavenging Ooze offer some sustainability and resilience. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and formidable aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the key cards Goblin Electromancer and Pyromancer Ascension to reduce mana costs and duplicate spells, increasing the storm count to cast a lethal Grapeshot. Cantrips like Serum Visions and Thought Scour help dig through the deck quickly, while rituals like Desperate Ritual and Pyretic Ritual provide additional mana to chain spells together. Past in Flames serves as a powerful recursion tool to flashback spells from the graveyard, ensuring a consistent and explosive win condition through casting a high number of spells in a single turn.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing their threats, and generating value through creature abilities and card advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support multiple colors, allowing for flexibility in playing different types of spells. By utilizing powerful instant-speed spells and resilient creatures like Geist of Saint Traft and Restoration Angel, the deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents in a longer game, ultimately gaining the upper hand and securing victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and creature threats like Blade Splicer, Geist of Saint Traft, and Restoration Angel. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. The goal is to maintain board control, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and apply pressure with efficient creatures. The inclusion of cards like Snapcaster Mage adds versatility and card advantage to ensure the deck can adapt to various situations and emerge victorious in the long game.

The deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Knight of the Reliquary, and Thundermaw Hellkite while using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color combination and utilize the powerful abilities of cards like Kessig Wolf Run and Horizon Canopy. By utilizing mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise, the deck aims to play its threats ahead of curve and overwhelm the opponent with efficient beats and burn spells.
